byline.contributor: Marc Santora, Nikita Stewart and Vivian Yee contributed reporting.

abstract: News Analysis; New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio delivers State of the City speech, describing his plans for development and rectifying income inequality; does not address police-community relations or give specifics of how new affordable housing would be funded.
lead_paragraph: Mayors often use their annual speech to outline a raft of proposals, but Bill de Blasio spoke mostly about a plan that would transform neighborhoods from Staten Island to Brooklyn.

headline.main: State of City Address: Full of Ambition, but Light on Details
headline.print_headline: State of City Address: Full of Ambition, but Light on Details

snippet: Mayors often use their annual speech to outline a raft of proposals, but Bill de Blasio spoke mostly about a plan that would transform neighborhoods from Staten Island to Brooklyn.
